"Trust" is a political thriller film that tells the story of an American political consultant, played by Jon Voight, who is hired to run a campaign for President of the United States.
In conclusion, "The Next Three Days" and "Trust" are two excellent movies that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

Both movies are based on real-life stories and have a strong focus on character development and relationships between characters.
In "Love Ranch", the story revolves around a married couple who opened the first legal brothel in Nevada. The movie explores themes such as love, marriage, money, power, and corruption.
In "The Fighter", the story revolves around a fledgling boxer named Mickey Ward who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness. The movie explores themes such as love, marriage, money, power, and corruption.
